items.summary:
## Description
Configure and create more stable locations in Starsector.
items.description:
## Description
Configure and create more stable locations in Starsector.
In vanilla, you can create a stable location by "talking" to a star or blackhole (1 time per star system).
The mod increase the max stable locations you can create in the system, and can configure costs/story points.

## Download
Direct download from Github: https://github.com/DarkbordermanModding/Starsector-AddStableLocations/releases/download/0.0.0/addstablelocations-0.0.0.zip
Source code from Github: https://github.com/DarkbordermanModding/Starsector-AddStableLocations

## Changelog
```diff
+++Version 0.0.0
+Initial release
+Change max stable location creation count in system to 3(1 and 2 in vanilla)
+Costs, max stable location creation count and be configured in data/config/settings.json
```

items.name: Automated Commands
items.summary:
This mod adds new hullmods that allow the player to set predefined battle commands for AI-piloted ships in their fleet.
e.g. The Auto retreat command hullmod will force the ship to retreat when below a certain hull integrity level.
items.description:
This mod adds new hullmods that allow the player to set predefined battle commands for AI-piloted ships in their fleet.
e.g. The Auto retreat command hullmod will force the ship to retreat when below a certain hull integrity level.

__Current Features__
**Retreat** when the ship is below a certain **hull integrity** level. (90% or 60% or 30%)
**Retreat** when the ship has exceeded its **peak performance** time.
**Retreat** when the ship is below a certain **CR level**. (60% or 40% or 0%)
**Retreat** when the ship has **no missile left**. (the hullmod can only be added to ships with least one missile weapon equipped)
Forced **vent** when ship's flux is at 80% (or higher)
Carriers will automatically toggle between **engage and regroup** when their replacement is at 20% or 80%

Override the **personality** for non-officered ships (works for flagship on auto)



__Installation__

Just download the mod and unpack the ZIP file into your mods folder.
Download: https://github.com/borgrel/AutomatedCommands/releases/download/v1.4/AutomatedCommands.v1.4.zip
Forum Thread: https://fractalsoftworks.com/forum/index.php?topic=21576.0

items.description:
Special thanks to 5ColouredWalker, Indie Winter and jamitron for their help with this update. 
On a side note, I was asked to make some pirate ships for JYD but I felt that would not jive with their lore so I made a couple for CFT as they are pirate adjacent. I did not include them in this update because:
1)They still need work and I wanted to get these fixes out asap
2)Does the game really need more Dazs Kitbashes? 🙂

I included the three "work in progress" pirate ships I made in the Zip, they are located in graphics\ship and labeled CFT_pirate 1, 2 and 3 if you want to give any opinions. On a side note you may recognize one as the now retired Covetor(p) from BigBeans Ship Compilation. I was a fan and used that ship in my wolfpack fleets. Since CFT uses the Shellster assets that the Covetor is taken from, I took the base sprite from Spiral Arms and re-created it with it's own skin. (BB's is better for sure but I am a hack so I did my best) 

Enjoy!

items.name: EHM: Experimental Hull Modifications v0.8.1
items.summary: PS: Received some complaints about my balance ideas. May implement some of them as an optional setting at some point.
items.description:
PS: Received some complaints about my balance ideas. May implement some of them as an optional setting at some point.

0.8.1 change log:

A new hull modification which turns automated ships to normal, or normal ships to automated. Its tooltip is dynamic and will tell you about bonuses / penalties. Having the skill "Automated Ships" is required.

Other than that, there are a few "balance" changes, and fixes. First thing that's thrown out of the window with this mod is balance but I'll still try to achieve some semblance of "balance" whenever I can. Even though it's probably impossible!

- Added a new hullmod "AI Switch"; turns automated ships into normal, and normal into automated
- Added energy version of HBI; built-in HBI is replaced with HEI when Mass Energy Retrofit is installed
- Over-Engineered slot point bonus changed to 1/2/3/5* (from 1/2/4/6), OP bonus lowered to 15% (from 20%)
- Slot points gained through Over-Engineered and Auxillary Generators increase DP by 1 per slot point
- Mass Missile Retrofit OP cost reduced to 6/12/18/30 (from 8/16/24/40). It now raises missile weapon OP cost by 2/4/8
- Fixed weapon checks ignoring activated shunts on the adapted slots which allowed adapter activator removal
- Fixed some incorrect text in the settings
- Updated some tooltips
- Restored the unmodification

\* The game will load fine, but you may be in a slot point deficit. No penalties for this state, just a heads-up!

items.name: Exotica Technologies
items.summary:
Upgrade your ships using resources, credits and salvaged technology. Fight stronger enemy fleets!
` `
items.description:
Upgrade your ships using resources, credits and salvaged technology. Fight stronger enemy fleets!
` `
Exotica Technologies offers an RPG element to Starsector that makes your ships AND enemies harder, better, faster, stronger through upgrades and exotics! These upgrades do not take OP or hullmod slots! Each ship has a limit to the number of upgrades they can install so choose wisely! The cost of each upgrade will require common materials salvaged across the sector such as metal and transplutonics. However, as upgrades get more complex and specialized, they tend to consume more resources and even demand special items found through research stations and mining stations!

Changelog:
```
1.5.3
- updated for 0.96a
- fixed guerilla penance engine sometimes disabling the ship permanently
- fixed hacked missile forge reloading much faster than intended
- fixed phased fighter tether breaking terminator sequence
- fixed exotica market allowing you to go into debt
- fixed hyperspec LPC adding 1% for each fighter bay removed rather than multiplying
- reduced exotic drop rate from fleets
```

Save compatible with all previous versions of Exotica and can be added mid-save with no loss of functionality, even for salvage exploration. This mod does not affect drops of other exploration items, namely colony items, and are rolled completely separately.

items.name: Furry Portrait Pack 1.16
items.summary: A pack of around 100 portraits provided by the community.
items.description:
A pack of around 100 portraits provided by the community. 

```Changelog:
- added more portraits (this is the same for basically every version)```

If you want your own art in here:
- DM me (if you're in this server you do not need to send me a friend request- I will probably reject it)
- send me a 128x128 png. Images must be color and should include the head and shoulders on a black background. See the portraits in the pack for examples.
- Images should meet some minimum standards of quality, and should be drawn/painted, not pixel art. See the portraits in the pack for examples. I'm not saying you need to go out and spend $600 on an oil painting of your fursona, but it should be at least decent.
- Also send me something to indicate that you actually own/commissioned/drew whatever you just sent me. Using stuff that isn't yours will mean I just block you. Credit will remain anonymous unless you specifically ask for it in there.
- I don't care if the original image is SFW or NSFW as long as it's not obvious that it's cropped from something explicit. (ie, a crop of a nude ref sheet is fine; a crop of an o-face is not.)
- Tell me what faction(s) you want your portrait to be in. I'm not going to add your art to a modded faction unless the author's given permission for me to add portraits (apex design, exalted, keruvim).
- Tell me whether you want masculine or feminine pronouns. This will determine what pronouns the game uses in dialogue for players and NPCs with your portrait. (Starsector does not support gender-neutral pronouns for NPCs, for now)
- Assuming you did all that correctly, I'll add it in next time I feel like updating the pack. I can usually provide you with a version you can use quickly, but I only push out public updates when I have a few portraits to add.

ISAF - Independent Starfighter Acquisition Forum
items.summary: **RC3 changes**:
items.description:
**RC3 changes**:

-CGS now officially classified as ballistic weapon that does energy damage. Don't know how I missed this for so long. Didn't break my save cause I actually implemented this change under the hood mid-campaign but YMMV; just giving you a heads-up.
-CGS fire-rate doubled from 0.05 to 0.1 - I originally just copy-pasted the vanilla vulcan fire rate when making this in the first place cause I wasn't sure if it'd even work. 
-Super Saker, Saker shield efficiency retuned. Logistics costs bumped up slightly. Yes, I nerfed them but playing a meme run where my fleet is just carriers with saker LPCs and saker strikecraft? They're doing just fine.
-Super Saker now has AAF lmao - the CGS reclassification meant high energy focus doesn't do anything anymore. Also pairs nicely with the CGS cause it allows you to have the old fire-rate for burst damage periods. :D
-I've added custom nex starts under the free start/own faction options! Now includes vanilla carrier variants bundled with Saker LPCs.
-Shield values adjusted once more because I have a smoothbrain and thought that the closer to 1.0 the better. Whoops.
-LPC Sakers got a buff. They get a dinky little shield that won't last long at all but at least it lets them last long enough to fire off a missile or two before going poof.

Adds images to all vanilla planets, a way to change them, 500+ AI-generated illustrations to choose from for your own colonies, and allows you to edit and add descriptions to your own planets with an in-game UI.

VRAM-Impact is around 70 mb during normal gameplay because the mod only loads images that you look at. 
However, it cannot un-load them, so VRAM use can be up to 250mb depending on your actions. Restarting the game will clear the image cache.

items.name: Ship Browser 1.1
items.summary: Do you have a chronic mod addiction that makes the list ships command produce several pages of console output? Do you like testing out ideas for fleets but hate flicking though the variant editor for 5 minutes straight adding smods?  I do, and I have spent hours automating parts of these minor inconveniences.
items.description:
Do you have a chronic mod addiction that makes the list ships command produce several pages of console output? Do you like testing out ideas for fleets but hate flicking though the variant editor for 5 minutes straight adding smods?  I do, and I have spent hours automating parts of these minor inconveniences.

Some commands include:

**ShipBrowser**
Opens a gui ship browser that's organised by mod and ship class. The gui opens after the console is closed.

**CloneShip <shipNumber> [numberOfClones]**
Creates a copy of a specified ship in the player fleet. "shipNumber" is the order that ships appear in the refit screen. For example the fifth ship from the top in the refit sceen would be ship number 5. "numberOfClones" is a number that defaults to 1 if not specified.

**FindSystemsWithTags <manditory1stTag> [optionalAdditionalTags]**
List the star systems with all of the tags specified in the arguments. A list of tags can be found in com.fs.starfarer.api.impl.campaign.ids.Tags of the StarSector API. Input the string that corresponds to the tag obtained by viewing Constant Field Values. Can be used to find hypershunts and remnants

**AddDMods <shipSelection> <numDmods>**
Adds "numDmods" dmods to the ships specified by "shipSelection". "NumDmods" is a number. "shipSelection" can be a number (eg. 5), a range (eg, 5-10) or the word all. The numbers in "ShipSelection"  corresponds to the order ships appears in the fleet or refit screen. For example the fifth ship in the refit screen is ship 5.

A full list of commands can be found on the forum post. Note that some of the fleet editing commands don't work while the refit screen is open for some reason. No clue why

Download: https://github.com/itBeABruhmoment/ShipBrowser/releases/download/1.1/ShipBrowser1.1.zip
Forum: https://fractalsoftworks.com/forum/index.php?topic=26261.msg390257#msg390257

` `
Take No Prisoners offers a narrative experience that most mods do not by allowing you to take enemy prisoners captive and actually have a one-on-one conversation with them rather than picking a dialog option that just gives you free money. Most vanilla factions have their own defined dialogues as part of this mod, so the prisoners you capture will be different across factions, and sometimes even within factions!

Phillip Andrada: Gas Station Manager has an extensive amount of content added if this mod is installed.

items.name: Truly Automated Ships v1.2.5
items.summary: This mod changes the way AI cores on automated ships affect the rest of your fleet, making them more independent but also more expensive to maintain.
items.description:
This mod changes the way AI cores on automated ships affect the rest of your fleet, making them more independent but also more expensive to maintain.

In the vanilla game, AI officers increase the "automated ship points" of the ship they're attached to, and to me it doesn't make sense. If your automated fleet relies on the computing power of the rest of the fleet to coordinate itself - and that's why having too many automated ships leads to a decrease in maximum efficiency for all of them - then grabbing a tonne of GPUs and stitching them together with a ship should actually lift some of the weight from your regular ships, not add even more!

With this mod, when you slap a supercomputer on a hull, it will actually make the ship more autonomous, and decrease its "automated ship points," leaving you with the ability to increase the size of your automated fleet even more! But beware: all of this added computing power will require constant maintenance and a large energy supply. After all, you wouldn't expect a giant AI core with the capacity to manage entire planets to be easy to sustain, would you? The good news is that small ships will be reasonably cheap, but as hull size increases, so do maintenance costs.

v1.2.5 changelog
```
- Fixed bug with CR calculation
- Implemented compatibility with Tahlan Shipworks 1.2.1
```

Save compatibility notice
```
This mod is compatible with preexisting savefiles. However, after activating the mod you'll have to remove all AI cores already assigned to your ships and then reassign them, or CR calculation will be bugged for those ships.
If you have any ships with integrated cores, CR calculation will be bugged regardless. I'm working on fixing this.
```

Direct download: https://github.com/TobiaFi/TrulyAutomatedShips/releases/tag/v1.2.5
Forum Thread: https://fractalsoftworks.com/forum/index.php?topic=21547.0
